text:
I've locally merged the current version of main with my api-base. The only conflicts were differences in application.properties and build.gradle. For testing purposes, I just went with the main's version of application.properties and build.gradle to see how it would work. I can do a bootrun with no errors. However when I navigate to localhost:8080 I'm getting errors in the console and the page is blank with error 401.

The errors in the console say "Not injecting HSTS header since it did not match request to [Is Secure]" also "org.springframework.security.access.AccessDeniedException: Access Denied"

If I go to the react side of our project I can login and log out, but when I click the "Test" button I get two errors that say:

"Caused by: org.springframework.security.oauth2.jwt.BadJwtException: An error occurred while attempting to decode the Jwt: Invalid JWT serialization: Missing dot delimiter(s)"

"Caused by: java.text.ParseException: Invalid JWT serialization: Missing dot delimiter(s)"

elements.text:
I've locally merged the current version of main with my api-base. The only conflicts were differences in application.properties and build.gradle. For testing purposes, I just went with the main's version of application.properties and build.gradle to see how it would work. I can do a bootrun with no errors. However when I navigate to localhost:8080 I'm getting errors in the console and the page is blank with error 401.

The errors in the console say "Not injecting HSTS header since it did not match request to [Is Secure]" also "org.springframework.security.access.AccessDeniedException: Access Denied"

If I go to the react side of our project I can login and log out, but when I click the "Test" button I get two errors that say:

"Caused by: org.springframework.security.oauth2.jwt.BadJwtException: An error occurred while attempting to decode the Jwt: Invalid JWT serialization: Missing dot delimiter(s)"

"Caused by: java.text.ParseException: Invalid JWT serialization: Missing dot delimiter(s)"

text: Also are we still planning on meeting up tonight?

elements.text: Also are we still planning on meeting up tonight?

text: I'm getting the exact same errors when running from Main, so this isn't related just to my branch. Seems like part of the issue is my token isn't updated. Any idea how to fix this?

elements.text: I'm getting the exact same errors when running from Main, so this isn't related just to my branch. Seems like part of the issue is my token isn't updated. Any idea how to fix this?

text:
I assume you get 401 because you don’t add token to your request

If you want to make public some endpoints, for example root (“/“) you need to make changes in security config

elements.text:

If you want to make public some endpoints, for example root (“/“) you need to make changes in security config

text: i’m still good to meet tonight

elements.text: i’m still good to meet tonight
